snippet: The Community Preservation Corporation has teetered at the brink of collapse after straying far from its original mission of financing the creation of apartments for those in need.
abstract: Community Preservation Corporation, established in 1974 to finance the creation or rehabilitation of rent-regulated, multifamily apartments for the poor and working class across the New York City area, teeters on the brink of financial collapse; critics say that the nonprofit group strayed from its core mission, tempted into speculative and increasingly risky lending for luxury condominium projects through a for-profit arm.
lead_paragraph: The Community Preservation Corporation has teetered at the brink of collapse after straying far from its original mission of financing the creation of apartments for those in need.

headline.seo: Community Preservation Corp. Hobbled by Housing Investments
headline.main: Lured by Visions of Real Estate Profits, Nonprofit Group Stumbled
